intro: Perdicium niveum, commonly known as the snow larkspur, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture, and its root system consists of thick, fleshy rhizomes. Perdicium niveum thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. It is noted for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
